content:
Diagnosis:		P16 positive T2N0M0 oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma

Management:		Completed radical chemoradiotherapy March 2024 (70Gy in 35 fractions with concurrent cisplatin)

Current Situation:	First post-treatment review

[redacted name] attended clinic today for first review following completion of radical chemoradiotherapy. He has recovered well from treatment with improving swallowing function and is now managing a soft diet. His weight has stabilized at 72kg. Mild xerostomia persists but is manageable with regular sips of water. Voice quality has returned to near baseline. No concerning symptoms reported.

Clinical examination shows good healing of the oropharyngeal mucosa with no evidence of residual or recurrent disease. Neck examination is unremarkable with no palpable lymphadenopathy.

I have arranged a 3-month post-treatment MRI and PET-CT scan. We will review him again in clinic with these results. In the meantime, he has the contact details for our specialist nursing team should any concerns arise.

patient_facts.value: Mild xerostomia managed with regular sips of water
Good healing of oropharyngeal mucosa, no evidence of residual or recurrent disease

status_updates.value: First review following radical chemoradiotherapy for p16 positive oropharyngeal cancer. Good recovery with improving symptoms and no evidence of disease on examination
Completed planned course of radical chemoradiotherapy
Managing soft diet with stable weight at 72kg
3-month post-treatment MRI and PET-CT scan arranged
Review in clinic with scan results
